data.title: Loved this B&B
data.text:
Very quaint! Very clean. Very friendly. And the breakfast was delicious!! 
Dan was very helpful with suggestions of places to eat it in town and places to go and visit. Can't wait to go back! 
It was also very quiet and well maintained.

data.title: Mini reunion
data.text: In LC for mini reunion with college friends. I did not stay there but visited. Very nice and affordable though part of town not the most desirable. Owner, a chef, owns Pujo Street Cafe, see my review. Nice change from typical hotel. Worth it I think.

data.title: Place was acceptable
data.text:
I was not "wowed" like the rest of the reviews.  The room was nice and clean, but the towels were old and ragged, The cheap bathroom rug and toilet cover really bothered me, I cannot imagine the germs on these!  
The breakfast was nice, but not "gourmet" based on previous reviews and as stated on the website.   Eggs, a piece of melon with a slice of meat with toast is not my idea of gourmet, especially based on the price.  JustMyOpinion

data.title: What a find!
data.text:
Our hotel was not available for a second night, my wife found this B&B in a visitors brochure... now i wish we could have stayed here both nights!

Such a cute homey house, comfortable and so peaceful. Can leave the casinos and enjoy a completely different world of charming downtown Lake Charles. 

Tried dinner at the owner's restaurant two blocks away..Pujo Street Cafe... AMAZING!

Owner so gracious, we will be back!

data.title: Weekend getaway
data.text: Very clean and friendly place. This is our second visit! Dan the owner is very nice and also a great chief. He owns a restaurant 2 blocks down with in walking distance! Both places are nice!  The house is  beautiful and the rooms are comfy-  great and lovely bed and breakfast. The Breakfast is amazing ! Worth the trip

data.title: Nice place, great host
data.text:
We arrived later in the day on Saturday, around 4.00 and my missus was feeling rough. We went and had a nice early dinner at the Pujo Street Café (Dan, the B&B owner is a chef there) and came back to our room. Dan made us feel very welcome at check-in and offered to take our bags to our room. Good parking at the bad of the B&B if you didn't want to park on the street. 
The room was large (room 4 IIRC) and was spotless with good amenities but by this time, my wife was feeling quite bad and so we had an early night and decided to return home to Texas the following day instead of continuing on our Florida road trip. 

The next morning, Dan was really kind and helpful as she was not really hungry and feeling terrible.  He made Eggs Benedict (wonderful!) for me and some tea and toast for Deb. We can heartily recommend Aunt Ruby's, a charming place with an hospitable host.

This is a nice, peaceful place and handy for downtown Lake Charles and the Pujo Street Café is only a 3 minute walk down the street.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Great place. Just tried it and love it. The bar is really great. Bourbon drinkers will love it. I had the Basil Hayden.  I had the blacken chicken for dinner. Simple dish but cooked to perfection. The staff greeted me nice and the waiter was outstanding. Not sure what ask could have been done.  Outstanding service. Will be back!!

data.title: Great place
data.text: Aunt Ruby's is a really nice place. It is in an old Lake Charles home that has been renovated into a very well kept bed and breakfast. Great bed/bath amenities, modern room, delicious food. Owner also connected to the nearby Pujo Street Cafe so the breakfast was special. Convenient location and good parking.

data.title: What a charming little place.
data.text: Aunt Ruby's is a charming restored old home, conveniently located in downtown Lake Charles. Dan, the owner of the B&B was very nice and an excellent cook. The room was very clean and the whole place was very peaceful. We plan on staying there on our next trip as well. BTW, the picture above has nothing to do with the B&B. I don't know why it is on this sight. Check out their website for accurate photos. Happy Travels!

data.title: UNE ÉTAPE CERTES
data.text: Nous avions réservé cette étape au cours de notre road trip. Honnêtement, Lake Charles ne casse pas trois pattes à un canard. Mais bon. Le B&B est correct. Le petit déj aussi ; le propriétaire Dan est serviable. Il possède un restaurant ) deux pâtés de maison.

data.title: Chambre de style ancien mais très confortable, très calme et petit déjeuner de chef.
data.text:
La chambre située au rez de chaussée comprenait une salle de bain avec baignoire, douche et WC. La chambre meublée de style ancien était très confortable avec un lit douillet, king size. Dans le réfrigérateur, quelques boissons fraiches étaient offertes. En face de la chambre, la cuisine pour le petit déjeuner, préparé par Dan qui tient un très bon restaurant à quelques maisons de là. Dan est très sympathique. Un coin salon est également disponible au rez de chaussée. La chambre est équipée comme un 3 étoiles. Le confort est bien à la hauteur.
Un souci, Dan n'est pas facilement joignable. Pas de mail sur son site internet. Lorsqu'on appelle son numéro de téléphone, on a souvent affaire à son répondeur.
Qu'à cela ne tienne, j'ai quand même pu réserver de France. Et à mon arrivée aux Etats Unis, j'ai pu le contacter pour convenir du rendez-vous.
